intro: Lychnophora riedelii, commonly known as the Riedel's lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and woody stems. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
